document.p: Performs computations on two input values.

Add: computes the sum of the inputs. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.

Sub: computes the difference of the inputs. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.

Mul: computes the product of the inputs. On vectors, this is performed component-wise. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.

Div: computes the division of the inputs. On vectors, this is performed component-wise. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.

Mod: computes the modulo division of the inputs. On vectors, this is performed component-wise. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.
Dot: computes the scalar product of the inputs. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes, or if one of the inputs is scalar.
Cross: computes the cross product of the inputs. The operation is only valid on 3D vectors.

Atan2: computes the arctangent of the inputs. On vectors, this is performed component-wise. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.

Min: computes the minimum of the inputs. On vectors, this is performed component-wise. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.

Max: computes the maximum of the inputs. On vectors, this is performed component-wise. The operation is not valid if the two inputs are vectors of different sizes. If one of the input is a vector and the other is a scalar, the scalar is converted to a vector whose components are all of the value of the scalar.
